insurgent attacks Shiites across the
country in Baghdad they blew up cars and

later in the day in the southern part of
the country a suicide bomber attacked
pilgrims making a trek to the holy city

government to a halt the shiite-led
government of Prime Minister Nouri
al-maliki has accused the country's
Sunni vice president of operating a

country Sunnis to accuse the government
of trying to marginalize them the
attacks appeared in the trying to incite

like they did at the height of the

today so we're here in New Hampshire
five days before the Republican
presidential primary where Rick Santorum
is trying to build on his strong finish
in Iowa he raised more than a million
dollars in his first day but now he's
trying to build a campaign organization
on the fly as his aides do that he is
pressing a message of economic populism
he's urging voters to listen to his
message of economic liberties and
freedom he's going beyond his his social
conservative message that got him to
this point ladies and gentlemen people
don't elect a president because of the

they elect a leader that they trust he's
reminding voters that he's from

could be he's striking a blue-collar

conventional wisdom that Mitt Romney is
the most electable candidate in the race
I love this issue then I hear all the
time oh this certain candidate is the
most electable what would give you that
impression when is that candidate ever
run as a conservative and gotten any
votes some Republicans wonder why he's
here in New Hampshire at all why didn't
he go straight to South Carolina that
was a lesson that Mike Huckabee said he
wish he would have done back in two
thousand eight after he won the Iowa
caucuses but advisers to Senator
Santorum tell me that they believe that
you have to compete in every state we're
going to go out and show on a very short
time frame here in New Hampshire that we
will have what it takes to get the
momentum and to rise raise our numbers
up and to see that we're the kind of
candidate that the people of New
Hampshire can rally behind after two
presidential debates here over the
weekend senator Santorum is planning to
take a quick detour to South Carolina on
Sunday to start setting up his ground
game for the state's january twenty
first primary but the next stop in this
Republican nominating contest remains
here in New Hampshire Jon Huntsman is
trying to break into the race Newt

Ron Paul is campaigning here as well but
many Republicans are wondering if this

how the outcome of the New Hampshire

between mr. Romney and mr. Santorum and
in New York Times journalist reports
from Myanmar concealing his identity
because of long-standing restrictions on
press these are the Myanmar girls the
first girl band in Myanmar whose debut
albums out this month
the timing couldn't be better for the
baby Myanmar is a country changing fast
after decades of military rule a new
civilian government is promising
democratic reforms and the changes seem
to be trickling down into the budding
music scene I haven't seen this changes
before because I am in the control of
military government since my childhood
the government censors who for years
excised articles from newspapers and
band songs cutting anything that was
seen as too provocative or mildly
critical of the government now have a
lighter hand for me and my girls the
censorship would be a little bit opening
the more freedom so that's the good
change and the music style is changing
to some of the sensors decisions were
bizarre they banned brightly colored
wigs for the me and my girls now they
are allowed the sensors are also
permitting shorter hemlines and skimpy
outfits but there are still limits the
challenge for the band now is winning
hearts in a society that in many ways
remains socially conservative for Kimmy
a band member from chin state an
impoverished mountainous area along the
border with India the main problem is
overcoming poverty Kimmy is the daughter
of a church choir conductor she came to
Yangon Myanmar's main commercial city
when she was a teenager these days she
supports herself singing in restaurants
and bars
she has recorded two albums one of love
songs the other gospel hymns in Yemen is
so difficult to doing music because of
money rich people can do easily for me
it's difficult Wow Kimmy and the other
me and my girls practice in the dining
room of the old British colonial house
that their Australian manager Nickey may
rents the band's main preoccupation
these days is practice practice practice
they have concerts lined up in Myanmar
and in neighboring Thailand the first
step to what they hope will be
international fame
